intro: Onosma aspera, commonly known as the rough onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in high-altitude areas, where it adapts to cold and dry conditions. Onosma aspera is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
